div.l: The Coke of london̄ while the Reve spake
For Ioye hym thought / he clawed hym on̄ his bake
A ha koth he for cristes passion̄
This Myller hade a sharp̄ conclusion̄
Vp on̄ his argument of herbergage
Wele seid Salamon̄ in his langage
Ne bryng nat eủery man in to thyn̄ hous
For herberyng by nyght is ꝑperlyous
Wele ought a man avised for to be
Whom̄ that he brought / in to his privyte
I pray to god / so yeve me sorow and care
Yf eủere seth I hight hogge of ware
Herd I a myller͗e better sette a werk
He hade a iape of malice in the derk
But god forbede / that we stenten here
And therfore / yf ye vouchen saf to here
A tale of me that am a poure man
I woll yoᵘ tell / as wele as eủere I can
A litle iape that fell in our͗e Citee
Our͗e hoost answerd and seid I graunt it the
Now tell on̄ Roger͗e / and loke that it be gode
For many a pastee hast þᵘou laten̄ blode
And many a Iak of Dover͗e hast þᵘou sold
That hath ben̄ twyes hote and twyes cold
Of many a pilgryme hast þᵘou cristes curs
For of thy ꝑperselee / yitte þey fare the wors
That they han̄ eten̄ in thy stoble goos
For in thy shop̄ / is many a flye loos
Now tell on̄ / gentyll Roger by thy name
But yitte I pray the be nat wroth for game
A man may seye full soth in game and pleye
Þᵘou seist full soth koth Roger / be my feye
But soch pley / quadde pleye as the flemmyng seyth
And therfore harry Bailly be thy feyth
Be þᵘou nat wrooth / or we deꝑpart here
Though that my tale / be of an hostillere
But natheles I woll nat tell it yitte
But or we ꝑpart ywys þᵘou shalt be quytte
And ther͗e wᵗith all / he lough and made chere.
And seid his tale / as ye shall after͗e here
